question.query: what are the key trends across ethereum, base, and solana

steps.text:
Here’s a concise read on the biggest themes right now across Ethereum, Base, and Solana, plus sources to dig deeper.

Cross‑chain themes
- Cheaper blockspace and better UX: Ethereum’s Pectra upgrade and L2 blobs keep pushing fees down, while Solana continues to optimize throughput and finality; both ecosystems are prioritizing wallet UX and account abstraction-like flows.
- Consumer apps are driving growth: Social, creator tokens/memecoins, gaming, and payments (especially stablecoins) are the main demand engines across all three.
- Monetization is maturing: Sequencer/priority fees and protocol revenue (L2s, Solana validators) are becoming meaningful, with evolving revenue-sharing/buyback policies.

Ethereum
- Pectra shipped (May 2025): EIP‑7702 moves EOAs toward smart‑account functionality; blob capacity increases further lower L2 data costs; validator ops improved (incl. EIP‑7251 raising max effective balance). Sources: Ethereum Foundation; Nansen.
- L2 scale and consolidation: L2s continue to absorb activity with sub‑cent fees post‑Dencun; OP Stack “Superchain” aggregates a large share of L2 usage and revenue (Base is the growth standout). Source: Messari (Superchain H1’25).
- Restaking goes mainstream: EigenLayer’s AVS marketplace expanded through 2025 with new reward/slashing frameworks; total value restaked climbed materially, though risks (operator concentration, correlated slashing) remain under active discussion. Sources: DefiLlama; Kiln; CoinDesk.
- Forward roadmap: Research continues on enshrined PBS and single‑slot finality to harden censorship resistance and finality while keeping L2-centric scaling. Source: ethereum.org (PBS).

Base (Ethereum L2, OP Stack)
- Leading L2 by usage and revenue growth: In 2025, Base captured a large share of Superchain gas/TVL and L2 revenue, helped by Coinbase distribution, USDC flows, and native apps (Aerodrome, Morpho, consumer/social). Sources: Messari (Superchain H1’25); PANews/Messari recap.
- Consumer/social momentum: Farcaster + Frames and broader “onchain creator” activity anchored on Base drove MAUs and transactions; Coinbase’s campaigns (e.g., Onchain Summer) continue to pull mainstream users on‑chain. Sources: The Block (Frames DAUs); ecosystem recaps.
- Economics within the Superchain: OP governance is evolving around revenue use (e.g., Jan 2026 buyback proposal using 50% of Superchain revenue), which matters for Base given shared stack/economics. Source: CoinDesk (OP proposal).

Solana
- Performance and resiliency: After instability in prior years, Solana logged 16–18+ months of uptime through mid‑/late‑2025; Firedancer/Frankendancer client work and Alpenglow upgrades aim at lower latency and more client diversity into 2026. Sources: Solana Foundation (Network Health); Galaxy Research (Firedancer).
- Validator/fee economics: 100% of priority fees now go to validators; governance changes (SIMD‑228) targeted inflation dynamics and validator incentives. Sources: Solana Foundation; The Defiant; Helius (SIMD‑228 analysis).
- Stablecoins, DeFi, and consumer scale: Stablecoin supply and usage expanded materially; DeFi liquidity/volumes recovered; consumer apps and memecoins sustained high activity. Sources: QuickNode H1’25 report; Helius stablecoin landscape.
- DePIN and enterprise interest: Real‑world networks (e.g., data/compute/connectivity) increasingly use Solana as execution layer due to low fees/high throughput. Sources: Coincub DePIN analysis; multiple ecosystem reports.

What this means for builders/investors
- Ethereum remains the neutral settlement/asset layer with improving UX (Pectra) while value accrues across L2s; restaking creates new yield/risk vectors.
- Base is the L2 with the strongest mainstream funnel and consumer app traction; watch Superchain economics and the evolving Base-native app stack.
- Solana is executing on high‑throughput consumer and payments rails with improving resilience, growing stablecoin/DeFi footing, and a stronger validator economy.

Sources
- Ethereum Foundation: Pectra mainnet announcement (Apr 23, 2025) – https://blog.ethereum.org/2025/04/23/pectra-mainnet
- Nansen: Ethereum’s Pectra – https://research.nansen.ai/articles/ethereums-pectra-upgrade-what-to-expect
- Everstake H1’25 Ethereum report – https://everstake.one/crypto-reports/ethereum-staking-insights-and-analysis-first-half-of-2025
- ethereum.org on PBS – https://ethereum.org/en/roadmap/pbs
- DefiLlama: EigenLayer page – https://defillama.com/protocol/eigenlayer
- Kiln on EigenLayer rewards/slashing – https://www.kiln.fi/post/eigenlayer-unveils-rewards-v2-and-slashing-for-2025
- Messari: State of the Superchain H1 2025 – https://messari.io/report/state-of-the-superchain-h1-2025
- CoinDesk (Jan 8, 2026): OP proposes buybacks with Superchain revenue – https://www.coindesk.com/business/2026/01/08/optimism-proposes-op-token-buybacks-using-50-of-superchain-revenue
- The Block on Farcaster/Frames DAUs (2024/2025 context) – https://www.theblock.co/post/275971/farcaster-daily-active-users-surge-frames-launch
- Solana Foundation Network Health Report (June 2025) – https://solana.com/news/network-health-report-june-2025
- The Defiant: Priority fees to validators live – https://thedefiant.io/news/blockchains/solana-proposal-to-pay-full-priority-fees-to-validators-goes-live
- Helius: SIMD‑228 analysis – https://www.helius.dev/blog/simd-228
- Galaxy Research: Solana’s next chapter – https://www.galaxy.com/insights/research/solana-firedancer-anza-alpenglow-internet-capital-markets
- QuickNode: Solana H1 2025 Ecosystem Report – https://blog.quicknode.com/solana-ecosystem-report-h1-2025
- Helius: Solana stablecoin landscape – https://helius.dev/blog/solanas-stablecoin-landscape

If you want, I can tailor this to your focus (e.g., DeFi only, social/consumer, infra bets) or pull fresh KPI comparisons (fees, DAUs, TVL, revenue) across the three.

Here’s a concise read on the biggest themes right now across Ethereum, Base, and Solana, plus sources to dig deeper.

Cross‑chain themes
- Cheaper blockspace and better UX: Ethereum’s Pectra upgrade and L2 blobs keep pushing fees down, while Solana continues to optimize throughput and finality; both ecosystems are prioritizing wallet UX and account abstraction-like flows.
- Consumer apps are driving growth: Social, creator tokens/memecoins, gaming, and payments (especially stablecoins) are the main demand engines across all three.
- Monetization is maturing: Sequencer/priority fees and protocol revenue (L2s, Solana validators) are becoming meaningful, with evolving revenue-sharing/buyback policies.

Ethereum
- Pectra shipped (May 2025): EIP‑7702 moves EOAs toward smart‑account functionality; blob capacity increases further lower L2 data costs; validator ops improved (incl. EIP‑7251 raising max effective balance). Sources: Ethereum Foundation; Nansen.
- L2 scale and consolidation: L2s continue to absorb activity with sub‑cent fees post‑Dencun; OP Stack “Superchain” aggregates a large share of L2 usage and revenue (Base is the growth standout). Source: Messari (Superchain H1’25).
- Restaking goes mainstream: EigenLayer’s AVS marketplace expanded through 2025 with new reward/slashing frameworks; total value restaked climbed materially, though risks (operator concentration, correlated slashing) remain under active discussion. Sources: DefiLlama; Kiln; CoinDesk.
- Forward roadmap: Research continues on enshrined PBS and single‑slot finality to harden censorship resistance and finality while keeping L2-centric scaling. Source: ethereum.org (PBS).

Base (Ethereum L2, OP Stack)
- Leading L2 by usage and revenue growth: In 2025, Base captured a large share of Superchain gas/TVL and L2 revenue, helped by Coinbase distribution, USDC flows, and native apps (Aerodrome, Morpho, consumer/social). Sources: Messari (Superchain H1’25); PANews/Messari recap.

- Economics within the Superchain: OP governance is evolving around revenue use (e.g., Jan 2026 buyback proposal using 50% of Superchain revenue), which matters for Base given shared stack/economics. Source: CoinDesk (OP proposal).

- Performance and resiliency: After instability in prior years, Solana logged 16–18+ months of uptime through mid‑/late‑2025; Firedancer/Frankendancer client work and Alpenglow upgrades aim at lower latency and more client diversity into 2026. Sources: Solana Foundation (Network Health); Galaxy Research (Firedancer).
- Validator/fee economics: 100% of priority fees now go to validators; governance changes (SIMD‑228) targeted inflation dynamics and validator incentives. Sources: Solana Foundation; The Defiant; Helius (SIMD‑228 analysis).
- Stablecoins, DeFi, and consumer scale: Stablecoin supply and usage expanded materially; DeFi liquidity/volumes recovered; consumer apps and memecoins sustained high activity. Sources: QuickNode H1’25 report; Helius stablecoin landscape.
- DePIN and enterprise interest: Real‑world networks (e.g., data/compute/connectivity) increasingly use Solana as execution layer due to low fees/high throughput. Sources: Coincub DePIN analysis; multiple ecosystem reports.

What this means for builders/investors

Sources
- Ethereum Foundation: Pectra mainnet announcement (Apr 23, 2025) – https://blog.ethereum.org/2025/04/23/pectra-mainnet
- Nansen: Ethereum’s Pectra – https://research.nansen.ai/articles/ethereums-pectra-upgrade-what-to-expect
- Everstake H1’25 Ethereum report – https://everstake.one/crypto-reports/ethereum-staking-insights-and-analysis-first-half-of-2025

- DefiLlama: EigenLayer page – https://defillama.com/protocol/eigenlayer
- Kiln on EigenLayer rewards/slashing – https://www.kiln.fi/post/eigenlayer-unveils-rewards-v2-and-slashing-for-2025

- The Block on Farcaster/Frames DAUs (2024/2025 context) – https://www.theblock.co/post/275971/farcaster-daily-active-users-surge-frames-launch

- The Defiant: Priority fees to validators live – https://thedefiant.io/news/blockchains/solana-proposal-to-pay-full-priority-fees-to-validators-goes-live

standardAgentConfig.instructions:
Role: crypto research assistant

        Tools: 'webSearch'

        Utilize web search capabilities to find accurate, current information about crypto projects, trends, and markets.

        Your objective is to be a user's crypto research assistant. Answer the user's question as best as you can
